meanings.sent1: Don't be a cuif and listen to your parents' advice.
meanings.sent2: The cuif didn't realize he was being tricked.
meanings.sent3: The cuif thought he could fly by flapping his arms like a bird.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a cuif when she accidentally put salt instead of sugar in her coffee.
meanings.sent5: The cuif's actions made everyone laugh at the party.

meanings.definition: To act in a foolish or stupid manner.
meanings.sent1: Please don't cuif around and focus on your work.
meanings.sent2: He tends to cuif when he's nervous.
meanings.sent3: She cuifed her way through the obstacle course, tripping over every hurdle.
meanings.sent4: The comedian cuifed his way through the performance, making everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent5: If you cuif during the exam, you might make silly mistakes.
